stories.headline: Immigrants' deadly rides
stories.summary: Farmworkers in Immokalee, Florida, face hazardous transportation conditions while traveling to work, raising concerns over state regulation and safety in agricultural labor.

stories.headline: Borrowers buried under debt, fees
stories.summary: Georgia's transformation into a creditor-friendly state has left many borrowers struggling under high debts and fees, with a focus on fast foreclosure processes and small loan companies.

stories.headline: Detecting bloat in job claims
stories.summary: An investigation into New York state's economic development grants reveals that nearly half of the companies fail to meet job creation promises, often escaping penalties.
